ThingDef.label: Mauser G98
ThingDef.description: Imperial Germany. The G98 was the backbone of the Reich forces weaponry during the whole war.

ThingDef.label: Mauser 98k
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. A shortened version of the wellknown german bolt-action rifle, it was the bulk of Nazi Germany armed force weaponry during the whole war, it was supposed to be replace by the STG 44 at some point but the war ended way before it was possible.

ThingDef.label: G43
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The G43 is a semi-automatic rifle which was meant to be the successor of the Mauser 98 and its variants but was never able to do so.

ThingDef.label: Mauser G98 scoped
ThingDef.description: Imperial Germany. A G98 but scoped.

ThingDef.label: Mauser 98k scoped
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. A shortened and scoped version of the wellknown german bolt-action rifle, the unscoped version was the bulk of Nazi Germany's armed forces' weaponry during the whole war.

ThingDef.label: STG 44
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The STG 44 is considered by many to be the first proper assault rifle.

ThingDef.label: VG1-5
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The VG1-5 is one of the last ditch weapons ordered by the Nazi Party for the Volkssturm at the end of the war. The VG1 is crude but cheap to make.

ThingDef.label: MG 08-15
ThingDef.description: Imperial Germany. The MG08-15 is the light version of the MG 08, it's not really that light but portable by one man.

ThingDef.label: MG 34
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. a universal machinegun put in service before the beginning of WWII until the end of the war, it is reliable with a medium rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: MG 42
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The MG 42 was introduce in 1942, it's considered by many to be the best LMG of the war due to its really high rate of fire, reliability, quick-changing barrel its cost efficiency and cost in comparaison to its predecessor hte MG 34.

ThingDef.label: FG 42
ThingDef.description: German automatic rifle from WWII, specialy designed for paratrooper.

ThingDef.label: MP 18
ThingDef.description: Imperial Germany. arriving in too small number and too late. But was perfect for the new stormtroopers units.

ThingDef.label: MP 28
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The MP 28 is the successor of the MP 18,a really good SMG but heavy and way to expensive to make in war time. replaced in its role by the wide spread MP 40.

ThingDef.label: MP 40
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. A lightweight SMG carried by NCOs, tank crew and regular soldiers.

ThingDef.label: MP 3008
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The MP 3008 is one of the last ditch weapons ordered by the Nazi Party for the Volkssturm at the end of the war. The MP 3008 is crude but cheap to make.

ThingDef.label: Mauser C96
ThingDef.description: Imperial Germany. The first semiautomatic pistol adopted by the German Imperial Army, it remained in service up until WWII.

ThingDef.label: Luger P 08
ThingDef.description: Germany. The Luger P 08 is a semiautomatic handgun of the beginning of the 20th century, used at this time by mainly officers, artillery crews and sturmtruppen .

ThingDef.label: Walther P 38
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. Designed to replace the Luger P 08, the Walter P 38 was a robust and modern handgun, and was cheaper and way more robust than its predecessor.

ThingDef.label: Panzerschreck
ThingDef.description: Nazi Germany. The Panzerscherck is a simple tube that allow to fire a Rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, however it's also useful againt infantry and their cover.
